intro: Pedicularis versicolor, commonly known as the variable lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red and purple, depending on the variety. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Pedicularis versicolor thrives in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
